akn:content.akn:p: (a) To enforce the Convention, this chapter, and regulations prescribed under this chapter, the Secretary of the department in which the Coast Guard is operating may—

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Presumption Based on Safety Approval Plate.—

akn:content.akn:p: (c) A container bearing a safety approval plate authorized by a country that is a party to the Convention is presumed to be in a safe condition unless there is significant evidence that the container is in a condition that creates an obvious risk to safety.
(e) An order issued by the Secretary under this section remains in effect until—

akn:subsection.akn:heading: Notice of Defective Container to Country Issuing Safety Approval Plate.—

akn:content.akn:p: (f) If the Secretary has reason to believe that a container bearing a safety approval plate issued by another country was defective at the time of approval, the Secretary shall notify that country.
